content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Cable Factory Interface (approx. center between (1.5,19.5) and (3.5,17.5))
Consists of the following entities:
– Cable Factory Input Chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5) serving as the interface for incoming materials.
– Factory Burner Inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) for handling raw materials.
– Dedicated Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) placed at the factory interface.
– Assembling Machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) tasked with copper-cable production.

### Extraction Belt Depot (core at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5))
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden Chest at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as an isolated belt depot.
– Transport Belt Segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) placed adjacent to the depot chest to extend belt connectivity.
– Depot Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) whose pickup position (acting as the final target) is Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) for receiving items.

### Extraction System Node
Consists of the following entity:
– Extraction System Burner Inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop position Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5) used to initiate the extraction connection.

ERROR TIPS

– Transport Belt Connection Errors:
 • Repeated failures occurred when connecting transport belts because the target entity was interpreted as a Prototype.SteamEngine.
 • To avoid this, always add an inserter to relay items into the intended target instead of connecting directly to non-inserter entities.

– Placement Range Issue:
 • A wooden chest placement failed because the target position was too far from the player’s current position.
 • Ensure the player moves within the allowed placement range (max distance 10) before attempting to place an entity.

– Variable Reference Error:
 • An error arose from a NameError (“target_chest” is not defined) indicating an invalid variable reference.
 • Verify that all variables referencing entities are correctly defined and accessible in the current scope.

– Inventory Shortage:
 • An error indicating “No wooden_chest in inventory” occurred during an attempted placement.
 • Confirm that the required items are available in the inventory before executing placement actions.

NAMESPACE

(No agent-defined functions were reported.)
